nodes.title: Article S14
nodes.summary: This partial document contains the final articles (Art. 15, 16, and 17) of a legal decree or statute (labeled Article S14). The main points covered are: the definition and mission of the CNPEJ as a state-run charitable, non-profit organization tasked with liaising with international and national youth and child welfare bodies; the repeal of a specific prior decree (Cabinet Order CAB/2100/039/04/69); and the assignment of authority to the Secretary General of the Ministry of Youth and Sports for executing the decree, noting its effective date upon signature. The document also includes a site disclaimer stating the texts are unofficial and unverified.

nodes.title: Article S5
nodes.summary: This partial document, labeled as Article S5, outlines the specific goals and responsibilities of a committee dedicated to child and youth welfare. The article enumerates a comprehensive list of objectives, which include fostering harmonious development, supporting governmental and private initiatives, raising public awareness through conferences, designing assistance projects, conducting studies, coordinating provincial committees, liaising with national and international organizations, identifying and documenting maladjusted children (predelinquents and postdelinquents), engaging with various family movements, monitoring youths in educational/reform institutions, investigating causes of child hardship, constructing reception centers for abandoned or disadvantaged children, intensifying a national sponsorship system, disseminating information via media, and implementing measures from relevant ministries regarding delinquency.

nodes.title: Article S7
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the composition and structure of national and provincial committees related to Youth and Sports. It lists the specific members of the National Committee, which includes representatives from various government ministries, youth associations, and international organizations. It then describes the formation of Provincial Committees by gubernatorial appointment and mentions the provision for periodic general assembly meetings for all committee members.

nodes.title: Article S9
nodes.summary:
This partial document outlines the organizational structure and administrative rules for a national council (likely focused on youth and children). The main points covered are:

1.  **The Steering Committee's Composition and Roles:** It details the positions of the Secretary-General and four specialized members, each responsible for specific areas: finances and assistance, prevention and protection, training, and public relations/press.
2.  **Appointment of Committee Members:** Specifies that the Minister of Youth and Sports appoints steering committee members, based on proposals from the Secretary-General.
3.  **Voluntary Work and Compensation:** States that members of the national and provincial councils work voluntarily but receive a small per-session allowance.
4.  **Internal Regulations:** Establishes that the council's internal regulations must be approved by the Ministry of Youth and Sports upon proposal from the steering committee.
